intro: Leptocallisia monandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are velvety and often have a striking color contrast, with dark green upper surfaces and lighter undersides. Leptocallisia monandra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
